basics.name: Owen C. Derby
basics.summary:
I'm an engineer: I like solving problems and fixing things. Whether it's tracking down a bug or building a new sub-system, I'm adept at jumping into a variety of different projects and producing results. I prefer building backends and systems, but find myself producing a lot of javascript lately (a necessary evil of building things for the web). Detail-oriented and thorough, I take pride in my work.

When I'm not working, I like traveling, taking photos, and playing a variety of games with friends (so long as it involves more thinking than randomness). I'm also a ping-pong enthusiast, and have been known join in the occasional pick-up basketball or soccer game. Currently, I'm contributing actively to the [5calls](https://5calls.org) project and finding ways to empower my peers to be better citizens.

positions.title: Technical Product Manager
highlights: Led the company through a 4 month pivot to a new SASS data-interchange product for computational designers.
Established KPIs for the product, a roadmap to achieve them and oversaw its implementation by development teams.
Analyzed user behavior to prioritize new features and support sales and marketing in targeting customers.

positions.title: Software Engineer
highlights: Designed and built backend services in Go and associated SQL databases for user accounts, data and Stripe payments.
Created pipelines for collecting, cleaning, and combining GIS and zoning code data and Angular components for displaying the result in the [Metro](https://metro.flux.io/metro/) product.
Implemented logical subsystems for a 'building configurator', while helping re-scope the project to deliver a smaller set of features on time.

positions.title: Research Assistant
highlights: Developed [FlexGP](http://hdl.handle.net/1721.1/85216) â€“ a distributed, heterogeneous genetic programming system for machine learning.
Created a framework for running and analyzing FlexGP on an OpenStack cloud computing implementation.

positions.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
highlights: Designed and implemented a simple, light-weight genetic programming library in Java.

positions.title: Software Engineering Intern
highlights: Contributed to ongoing development of software control package for an autonomous farm tractor.
Expanded regression tests to exercise new system features and to assess improvements in system performance.

work.company: Mission Critical Technologies, Machine Learning and Controls Lab

positions.title: MCT Intern at NASA Ames Research Center
highlights: Expanded control software on lab test bed to incorporate acceleration measurements.
Implemented a simple fault detection and isolation algorithm to demonstrate system capabilities.

positions.title: Software Engineering Intern
highlights: Programmed a component to setup streams with onboard A/V driver for remote control over radio.
Designed and tested a logging application for real-time viewing and debugging of runtime data.

_volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.

publications.name: FlexGP: Cloud-Based Ensemble Learning with Genetic Programming for Large Regression Problems
publications.summary: Describes FlexGP, the first Genetic Programming system to perform symbolic regression on large-scale datasets on the cloud via massive data-parallel ensemble learning.

publications.name: Learning Regression Ensembles with Genetic Programming at Scale
publications.summary: Examines the challenge of producing ensembles of regression models for large datasets.

publications.name: Cloud Driven Design of a Distributed Genetic Programming Platform
publications.summary: Presents FlexGP, a distributed genetic programming (GP) system designed to efficiently run on the cloud.

_references.name: Erlich Bachman
_references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Richard, his performance working as a consultant for Main St. Company proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.
